definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: They discredited her good name with ugly gossip.
sentences.chinese: 他们用难听的闲言碎语来破坏她的好名声。

sentences.english: She decided to ignore the petty anti-feminist remarks.
sentences.chinese: 她决定不去理睬那些攻击女权运动的闲言碎语。

sentences.english: Burnt to cinders, we were told by the neighbourhood gossips.
sentences.chinese: 我们从街坊四邻的闲言碎语中得知他被烧成了灰。

sentences.english: She likes ( gossips ) about the neighbor's domestic problems.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢邻里间家庭纠纷的闲言碎语。

sentences.english: I had no idea of the circumstance behind the gossip.
sentences.chinese: 我并不了解这闲言碎语背后的真相。

sentences.english: Words are flowing out like endless rain into a paper cup.
sentences.chinese: 闲言碎语如连绵的雨点般渗透纸杯。

sentences.english: Burnt to cinders , we were told by the neighbourhood gossips.
sentences.chinese: 我们从邻居的闲言碎语中得知，他烧成了灰烬。

sentences.english: Don't worry. The gossip will go aways soon.
sentences.chinese: 不用担心，闲言碎语很快就会过去的。

sentences.english: The off-the-court buzz isn't that special.
sentences.chinese: 球场外的闲言碎语并不特殊。

sentences.english: Don't worry, these gossips will pass by.
sentences.chinese: 不用担心，闲言碎语很快就会过去的。

definition: rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
to spread malicious gossip/also written 飛短流長|飞短流长[fei1 duan3 liu2 chang2]
casual conversation/chat/gossip/to talk about (whatever comes to mind)
lit. to discuss sb's merits and demerits (idiom); to gossip
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to comment/to talk about/to discuss/discussion/CL:個|个[ge4]
